summary:
France, officially the French Republic, is a Western European country with overseas regions worldwide. It shares borders with many European nations and has a rich history dating back to the Iron Age. The French Republic was established after the French Revolution (1789), ending the monarchy.

France played a significant role in European history, especially under Napoleon Bonaparte, who ruled much of Europe. It is a founding member of the European Union and a global leader in art, science, and tourism. With a strong economy and a permanent seat on the UN Security Council, France remains a major world power.
title: France
